alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 7:28AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Central and Southern Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain returning to Southern and Central Santa Barbara County. Moderate to heavy showers are developing over the coastal waters, and spreading northward across Santa Barbara County. With saturated soils in many areas, minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Lompoc, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Carpinteria, Solvang, El Capitan State Beach, Refugio State Beach, Isla Vista, Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park, Los Alamos, Summerland, Rincon Point, Goleta, Buellton, Lake Cachuma, Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass, Figueroa Mountain, Santa Barbara Airport and Hope Ranch. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
